marketNews.title: Snips Recap 2023: Normalization of Commodity Prices and Inflation
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Chinese government has agreed to issue special treasury bonds worth 3 trillion yuan in 2025. This bond issuance is an all-time high and is intended to provide fiscal stimulus in an effort to revive the weakening Chinese economy. The Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association expressed objections to the government's plan to increase Export Proceeds (DHE) to 60%. This objection is accompanied by the consideration that the average selling price (ASP) of coal has experienced a significant decline. Furthermore, holders of Special Mining Business Permits (IUPK) in the coal industry are also subject to a progressive royalty rate of 28%. The government through the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkeu) will allocate 28.2 trillion rupiah for the procurement of 220,000 units of Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP) quota in 2025. The Commissioner of the Housing Provident Fund Management Agency (BP Tapera), Heru Pudyo Nugroho, stated that the distribution of FLPP will still use the existing scheme, which is 75:25. 75% of the funds will be subsidized from the State Budget (APBN), while the remaining 25% is allocated from banking. However, this allocation is still below the proposal of the Minister of Housing, Maruarar Sirait, who targeted the FLPP quota to reach 300,000 to 500,000 units. For information, the channeling of FLPP in 2025 can commence in January. The Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, revealed that not all school children in the free nutritious meal (MBG) program will receive milk in their menu. Dadan explained that milk distribution will be focused first in dairy farming centers areas. As an alternative, children will receive other side dishes such as eggs for protein needs and moringa leaves for calcium. The Chairman of the People's Consultative Assembly (MPR), Ahmad Muzani, conveyed that the government has the opportunity to review the application of the 12% Value Added Tax (PPN) on luxury goods which will start in January 2025. According to Muzani, this discussion will take place if the tax increase impacts the micro-economy sector.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) 11M24: Net Profit +4.7% YoY, Credit Cost Maintained
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded net profit (bank only) of 4.1 trillion rupiah (-9.7% YoY, +1.4% MoM) in November 2024. This result causes the bank only net profit for 11M24 to grow to 47.2 trillion rupiah (+4.7% YoY), above the consolidated FY24 growth estimate consensus at +2% YoY level. On the negative side, Net Interest Margin (NIM) and Non-Interest Income (NII) weakened. Meanwhile, on the positive side, credit cost (CoC) was maintained and credit growth remained strong. NIM in November 2024 weakened to 4.4% (-22 bps YoY, -17 bps MoM), so NIM for 11M24 decreased to 4.6% (-32 bps YoY). This result is below management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 5-5.3%. On the other hand, Non-II was recorded at 2.5 trillion rupiah (-19% YoY, -4.5% MoM) in November 2024, causing Non-II growth for 11M24 to slow down to +2% YoY (vs 11M23: +15% YoY, 10M24: +4.6% YoY). Due to the weakening of Non-II, the company's Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) was suppressed to 5.4 trillion rupiah (-2.6% YoY, -5.1% MoM) in November 2024. Nevertheless, PPOP performance for 11M24 is still categorized as good at 64.9 trillion rupiah (+6.1% YoY). BMRI CoC was at 0.3% (+28 bps YoY, -61 bps MoM) in November 2024. This result keeps CoC for 11M24 maintained at 0.7%, better than management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of <=1%. The annual increase in CoC is caused by a low-base effect in November 2023. BMRI recorded credit growth of +22.7% YoY in 11M24 (vs 11M23: +14% YoY, 10M24: +22.5% YoY), higher than management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 16-18%. On the other hand, third-party funds (DPK) grew +15% YoY (vs 11M23, +6% YoY, 10M24: +13% YoY) during 11M24. Although slowing down, BMRI's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) remained relatively high at 93.9% (vs 11M23: 87.7%, 10M24: 95.1%) in November 2024, one of the highest among other big banks. Key Takeaway: We assess the bank only performance of BMRI in November 2024 as quite good, especially from the company's success in maintaining CoC which indicates asset quality is maintained. Although NIM weakened, investors need to note that BMRI's consolidated NIM tends to be supported by subsidiary NIMs. On the other hand, BMRI's liquidity is considered tight compared to other big banks, so there is limited potential for future credit growth space and a risk of increasing cost of fund due to competition in growing DPK.

tickerNews.title: PANI Sells Land Worth IDR 62 Billion to Tzu Chi Foundation
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua through its subsidiary, PT Mega Andalan Sukses, conducted a sale of 13.8 thousand square meters of land to the Buddha Tzu Chi Wiyata Indonesia Foundation. The total transaction value reached 62 billion rupiah, and the land purchased by the Foundation will be developed into facilities/infrastructure beneficial to the community.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) November 2024 Sales and Production Update
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu brand heavy equipment totaling 403 units (-9% MoM, +9.2% YoY) in November 2024. Cumulatively over 11M24, Komatsu sales reached 4,167 units (-17.7% YoY), with a market share of 27% (vs. 10M24: 27%, 11M23: 30%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded a coal production volume of 137 million tons (+13.2% YoY) in 11M24, with overburden removal of 1,124 million bcm (+4.7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: TOWR to Distribute IDR 300 Billion Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: $TOWR: Sarana Menara Nusantara will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 300 billion rupiah or 6 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is January 6, 2025, with payment on January 22, 2025. Referring to the TOWR stock price at the market close on Tuesday (24/12) at 620 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 1.0%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) 11M24 Results: Net Profit +4% YoY, Credit Growth Aligns with Guidance
tickerNews.content: $BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia recorded net profit (bank only) of 1.7 trillion rupiah (+1.5% YoY, -7.6% MoM) in November 2024. This result causes profit for 11M24 to grow to 19.8 trillion rupiah (+4% YoY), below the consolidated FY24 growth estimate consensus at +5.8% YoY level. Provision expenses were recorded at 693 billion rupiah (+13% YoY, -2.1% MoM) in November 2024, so provision expenses for 11M24 slowed down to 6.4 trillion rupiah (-19% YoY). Credit grew by +11% YoY in November 2024 (vs 10M24: +8.8% YoY). This result is in line with management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 10-12%.

tickerNews.title: MMLP Shareholder Sells 192 Million Shares as Exchangeable Bonds Execution
tickerNews.content: $MMLP: Mega Manunggal Property shareholder, PT Mega Mandiri Properti, sold approximately 192 million MMLP shares at a price of 443 rupiah per share on December 13, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 85 billion rupiah and is intended as the execution of exchangeable bonds issued by West Bridge Developments Limited. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Mega Mandiri Properti in MMLP decreased from 2.79% to 0%.

tickerNews.title: MTSM Plans Hospital Acquisition Funded by Rights Issue in 2H25
tickerNews.content: $MTSM: Metro Realty plans to acquire a hospital with an estimated transaction value of 200 billion rupiah. MTSM Investor Relations & Business Development Manager, Saleh Basir, stated that this acquisition will be funded by issuing shares through a rights issue scheduled for 2H25.

tickerNews.title: Smartfren Telecom (FREN) Clarification Regarding $FREN-W2 Exercise Deadline Before Merger
tickerNews.content: Smartfren Telecom ($FREN) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the acceleration of the deadline for the execution of [$FREN-W2] is not regulated in POJK 32/2015 if there are still (i) warrants outstanding and not yet converted into shares of the public company and (ii) the public company will conduct a business merger. Furthermore, the statement in Article 13 of the Deed of Issuance Statement for Series III Warrants of 2021 which reads "Taking into account the prevailing laws and regulations, the Company may amend the Issuance of Series III Warrants, except for changing the Exercise Period, ..." is a provision to amend/change the provisions of the Issuance of Series III Warrants based on Deed 4/2021 generally and has no direct correlation with the provision in the event of a business merger. FREN's clarification emerged amid reports that Smartfren warrant holders would file a class action lawsuit because they felt harmed by the compressed warrant exercise deadline.
